title: Too many errors when `None` is used and its type can't be inferred due to other error

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-verbose
labels.description: Too much output caused by a single piece of incorrect code

body:
Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=64d84b2f67f4bbb9795a0a3c4382687e

```rust
fn main() {
    foo(None);
}

fn foo(a: Option<MyType>) {

}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0412]: cannot find type `MyType` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:5:18
  |
5 | fn foo(a: Option<MyType>) {
  |       -          ^^^^^^ not found in this scope
  |       |
  |       help: you might be missing a type parameter: `<MyType>`

error[E0282]: type annotations needed
 --> src/main.rs:2:9
  |
2 |     foo(None);
  |         ^^^^ cannot infer type for type parameter `T` declared on the enum `Option`

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors
```

Ideally the output should look like:

```
error[E0412]: cannot find type `MyType` in this scope
 --> src/main.rs:5:18
  |
5 | fn foo(a: Option<MyType>) {
  |       -          ^^^^^^ not found in this scope
  |       |
  |       help: you might be missing a type parameter: `<MyType>`

error: aborting due to previous error
```

The error about "type annotations needed" on the `None` is directly caused by the previous error and covers up the real source of what's problematic here. I think it'd be best if extra errors were suppressed from later stages in a situation like this.
